server

Class MongoDBController

  • java.lang.Object
    • server.MongoDBController

  • public class MongoDBController
extends java.lang.Object
    Class that handles the database, including several methods for retrieving or storing information in said database
    Author:
    Filip Weilid, Viktor Kullberg

        Parameters:

        ip - The IP-address the user had
        username - Username of the user
        lock - Name of the lock that the user interacted with

        Returns:

      • changeActiveStatus

        public void changeActiveStatus(java.lang.String mac,
                               java.lang.Boolean ActiveStatus)
        Changes the active field of a lock, true/false
        Parameters:
        mac - MAC-address of the lock we want to change active status
        ActiveStatus - Boolean whether or not the lock is currently active and can be interacted with

        Parameters:

        newLock - The name we want to change to
        Returns:
        Returns a string saying whether or not the change was accepted

        oldPassword - The current password of that user
        newPassword - The password we want to change to
        Returns:
        Returns a string saying if the change was accepted or not

      • addMasterLock

        public java.lang.String addMasterLock(java.lang.String mac,
                                      java.lang.String ip,
                                      java.lang.String type)
        Adds a masterlock, only one master lock can be added
        Parameters:
        mac - MAC-address of the masterlock
        ip - IP-address of the masterlock
        type - Type which is master
        Returns:
        Returns a string saying if we could add the lock or not

        role - The role we want to change to
